flowRoot.flowPara: T1 = torque on the axle of gear-1
Z1 = number of teeth of gear-1
R2, T2, Z2: idem for gear-2
A standard tooth (addendum = 100%, dedendum=100%, half-tooth-height=module) can modelized as a beam of section (1.5*m X H) and length 2.25*m (with H=heigh of the gear)
The pontual-force has a constant amplitude but its application point and its direction changed with the gear rotation.
The ponctual-force can be decomposed into:
T = Int(f(x)*x, -L/2, L/2) with f(x)=K*H*x and L=1.5*m
These provide the following material constraints:
